title: So Riot, Can We Admit the Syndra Nerfs Were Heavy Handed?
body:
Syndra's Q base, hitbox on her E, and DFG being removed (though Riot believed this to be a non-factor for Syndra.) have all contributed to Syndra's winrate being amongst the lowest in the game.

Can we admit she was over-nerfed and roll back some of this? I don't know who thought DFG being removed didn't impact Syndra that much but... As far as I am concerned it was just as essential of an item on her as DFG was on Veigar.

replies.body:
Agreed, she was hit harder than intended in a way that's left her E feeling like it sometimes misses when it's expected to hit. We're increasing the width on Syndra's stun in 5.4 (and to a greater extent than it was increased in 5.2). It's not going to be as wide as pre 5.1, which was unfairly wide, but should more consistently hit when it looks like it did.

After that change, which is both a feel and a power one, we'll look at where her balance stands, see if it's appropriate to do more.

Can you explain to me why anyone would pick Syndra over Annie right now? Not trying to be rude but I strongly feel Annie is the new Syndra, Plenty of AoE burst, Only down side is Annie's range is a lil shorter. But tibbers Ulti range makes up for it and is AoE, whereas Syndra's is single target. 

TL;DR  Syndra Fell and Annie Rose.

I wouldn't underestimate lower range as a factor in why you'd pick Annie or Syndra - Annie has to get close to unload her burst/CC - This can backfire. Syndra can sit from afar and throw stuns out until she gets a favorable engage.
I think she still bullies better than an Annie does in lane too and with a more safety.

Actually an Annie with her passive up is the best lane bully in the game. You risk losing a lot of health without being able to trade back if she has her stun up, after you are about 50% health early you even risk getting killed. And you never know if she is planning on using the stun on you in the first place, or is just zoning. At level 3 she can charge the stun super fast too.
Only {{champion:134}} can command Gromp to attack.  Thats the only reason I need.
kalista tp+syndra= gromp taking a very long walk home

Syndra still has a more reliable stun than Annie. Annie needs charges, while Syndra only needs to wait for cooldown. Annie has to be closer to land her stun. Syndra can land the stun from a safer range. 

Where i can give points to annie is the Flash-Tibbers AOE damage summon-plus-stun. That thing if landed correctly, can win you games.

Annie can easily charge her stun with Q refunding mana and reducing CD on last hits and her E having a decently low CD (if you count after the duration ends). Then she has either a point and click stun or 2 instant AoE ones.
Syndra has longer range AND she can cast while moving, something Annie can't do. This power alone is what I would consider to put Syndra on top.

This is such a slow process =/  Sure sounds to me like Syndra will be useless for at least four patches.  I mean, there's little reason to expect that 5.4 Syndra will be balanced if the plan is to basically do 5.2 again.

If I were in charge, I'd be doing a post mortem to figure out how such a bad change ever made it live.  I mean, when 5.1 hit I was convinced Syndra was bugged, that's how bad the feels were.  We're looking at edits to one ability in 3 out of 4 patches.  Seriously poor execution.

Am I the only one who thought DFG's deletion alone was enough of a nerf? Regardless of what Elo that was looked at in NA/KR/EU it was rare for her win rate to be above 48%. Plat/Diamond win rates do mean SOMETHING, they can't be ignored because the context behind it is there.

Syndra needed to be a lane bully from lvl 1 in order to transition into a reasonable mid game. - She lost that with the Q nerfs.

Syndra's mid game consisted heavily of getting picks with her Q -> E combo. - This doesn't work at all anymore, it fails over half the time with what looks like a direct hit dead centre. Patch notes claim in 5.2 this was improved yet I saw nothing but Q -> E's flying straight through the middle of even giant targets like Cho.

Syndra's late game, if online stats are to be believed, was always abysmal. For games over 40 minutes it was likely the lowest win in the game often in the 30s and sometimes even 20s (NA/KR/EU Plat+).

I thought after DFG's deletion she'd be left alone or perhaps receive a tiny buff to her late game. I didn't expect her to get Diana'd.

Hey Meddler, thanks for the update!  I've mained Syndra since she came out and have played her through the ups and downs. I am very happy that you guys are acknowledging that she was nerfed a bit too much. I have some thoughts:

1. I read through the patch notes dealing with the nerf (5.1).  I understand that her being a lane bully in counter pick scenarios is the main reason behind the nerf. From a purely statistical point-of-view, she had an almost perfect 49-51% win-rate. Even if she can be a lane bully, what is the reason behind re-balancing a champ that seemed pretty balanced?  I think it is pretty sad that she dropped from a 50% win-rate to a 42% win-rate (lowest in the game). 

2. I remember how buggy she was on release!  Besides the bug fixes that helped a lot, I know that she was buffed post-release (1.0.0.148). I remember those buffs making a night and day difference when playing her.  Particularly, her Q was buffed to 70/110/150/190/230 from 60/100/140/180/220 (release). In 5.1, Q's base damage was reduced to 50 / 95 / 140 / 185 / 230 from 70/110/150/190/230...   That means that release Syndra had a higher level 1 Q than current Syndra. Because there isn't numerical data on the nerf for E, it is hard to quantify the nerfs on her E.  I agree that some stuns were very generous. Before 5.1, I considered release Syndra her lowest point as a champion... Now that I have had two patches to play nerfed-Syndra, I believe she is at her worst point.  I feel like some bugs were reintroduced as well (stun detection on Q+E combo at close range).   It feels like all of those issues are compounded with the itemization changes.

If you do decide to do more, where would that lead to? Less damage and more utility? A  new ultimate that still effectively uses the amount of spheres up and holds her characterization? I had several ideas and thoughts on it.

You guys would hit anyone that bronzies cried about even if the champ requires more skills and mechanic to play like Azir (Radius W nerf instead of making W AP ratio scales per level).

But then again, your dear Ahri nerf is like so soft and fluffy. Your Lucian so called nerf even ended up being a buff at one point. Just saying.

Thank you meddler. The Q nerfs hurt too, when a leblanc or ahri can really chunk you with a small combo it does feel like Syndra did lose some of her early laning pressure, the thing was that she struggled setting up reliable ganks with her stun. So with that fixed up and all that it should give Syndra the love she needs to be a strong pick. 

Thanks again for helping syndra out, my MMR thanks you. {{champion:134}}
how about it hits not when it feels like it should hit but actually when it hits. I'm fine with syndra being buffed but I don't feel like fucking up her hitboxes again is the right thing to do.

Out of curiosity are you using a hitbox rather than a hitsphere for Syndra's orbs? Using boxes would naturally cause collision issues at certain angles, unless the hitbox actually aligns with the direction being travelled by the moving orb.

Technically, there's no Z-axis in League, so they'd be hitsquares or hitcircles, respectively. I think "hitbox" is a catch-all term independent of shape anyway. The orbs could easily have circular hitboxes.

Identity wise, she lost the aspect of being a "poison mage" to Singed.  They effectively took her kit, and put everything into one point and click ability, while the other abilities are just to keep her alive and let her spam. She's effectively Ryze 2.0.  Less AOE then Ryze 1.0, but more single target damage.

I'm not going to touch on identity issues of Cass since as I didn't play her, I have no right to comment on that.
However at the very least from a balance point of view, she's a really strong pick (even post-nerfs).
